title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Isabel read through the report several times. She noted the number of the house in Nile Grove and the name of the uncle who had been interviewed. He had an unusual name, Archibald, which would make it comparatively  easy to trace him, should she need to do so.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: It was a comfortable room, on the street side of the house, with bookshelves up one wall. It was typical, Isabel thought, of the rooms one would find in any of the houses along Nile Grove: a room which spoke to the solid, educated taste of the neighbourhood. Above the ornate Edwardian fireplace, with its fin de siècle painted tiles, was a painting of a young man's face in the style of Stephen Mangan – flat, almost one-dimensional, slightly haunting.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She had not intended to visit the house in Nile Grove until a few days later, but after an evening of thinking about it, she decided that she would go the next morning. It would be difficult to explain over the phone what she had in mind.
